div.ab: They mold better on a single leaf than n on a bouquet or a flower or the branch of a plant, because the single leaf molds in two halves, which, once reheated, can open and clean well, & the cast is made better. Take heed when taking the fly to not break the legs & to not let it dry too much, for then the legs fall off. And if this happens to you, glue with fish glue the same legs and with wax, or fashion some out of swine bristle or spinet string. Fix the leaf on the clay slab with two points, and the fly with one point in the middle of the body, & the legs with some wax.
